definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: I can tell you a lot of things about this family, Inspector.
sentences.chinese: 探長，我可以告訴你有關這個家的許多事。
偵探長的眼珠子都凸出來了。

sentences.english: She wanted everyone to see him, and listen to him, ’Inspector Walsh said.
sentences.chinese: 她想要大家都看見他，並聽他說話，”沃爾什探長說。

sentences.english: ‘Of course. This is your house, ’Inspector Walsh said.
sentences.chinese: “當然，這是你的家，”沃爾什探長說，他看着傑基。

sentences.english: Inspector Walsh looked at the things in the front room.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾什探長看着前屋的東西。

sentences.english: ‘Be quiet, please, and sit down, ’Inspector Walsh said.
sentences.chinese: “請安靜，坐下，”沃爾什探長說，看着傑基。

sentences.english: ‘I would like to talk first to your nucle, Albert King, ’Inspector Walsh said.
sentences.chinese: “我想先和你的姨父艾伯特金談談，”沃爾什探長說。

sentences.english: Inspector Walsh sat in his office and telephoned.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾什探長坐在辦公室打電話。

sentences.english: Inspector Walsh watched Roger for a minute.‘I
sentences.chinese: 沃爾什探長看了羅傑一會。

sentences.english: The house detective shook his head emphatically.
sentences.chinese: 偵探長斷然地搖了搖頭。

sentences.english: Inspector Walsh got his hat and coat.‘Come on.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾什探長戴上帽子穿上外衣。

sentences.english: ‘Of course.This is your house,’Inspector Walsh said.He watched Jackie.‘What
sentences.chinese: “當然，這是你的家，”沃爾什探長說，他看着傑基。
“這兒不值多少錢，”沃爾什探長說。

sentences.english: Inspector Walsh Watched and then walked slowly to his car.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾什探長注視着她，然後慢慢走向他的車。
女士們，先生們，是弗林探長。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
triad, Chinese crime gang/triad society, anti-Manchu secret society in Qing-dynasty China
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
